Pixel-Based Skin Detection using

Pixel-Based Skin Detection using Multispectral Imaging

front.div:
Abstract
In the computer vision domain, many applications could
greatly benefit from the availability of multispectral mea-
surement. In this paper we show how to create a skin detec-
tor by measuring multispectral data.
To obtain the multispectral data, we have built a system
using multiple LEDs with different spectra to illuminate the
scene and a conventional RGB camera to acquire images.
A methodology is proposed in this paper to avoid strict ex-
perimental environment requirement, by adopting a simple
training procedure which is tuned for the recognition of hu-
man skin. Next a specific feature set is defined and corre-
sponding normalization method is designed to improve the
robustness of skin detection to changes in skin color and
incident light, issues not addressed by available prior art.
At last we benefit from the power of AdaBoost to create an
accurate skin detector.
We conclude that the proposed skin detector classifies
skin and non-skin materials unaffected by ambient lights.
We demonstrate the accuracy and effectiveness of our skin
detector through extensive comparison and evaluation. Our
proposed detector enables a far superior performance of
skin detection compared to relevant alternative proposals.
